engineering_design_principles.mechanism: Facilitates efficient transfer of motion and energy between objects through strategic application of force over time.
Enables the optimization of changes in dynamic systems and supports controlled acceleration or deceleration of objects.
Mathematically defined as the integral of force with respect to time, demonstrating the geometric relationship between force, time, and resulting change in motion.
Allows for precise control and manipulation of alterations in a system by varying the force magnitude or duration of application.
